member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl

member.summary: Embeds text URL-encoded in a "data" URL (RFC 2397).

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl.FromFile(System.String,System.String,FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataEncoding)
member.summary: Embeds the content of a file in a "data" URL (RFC 2397).
member.param: Path to the file whose content is to embed in the "data" URL.
The Internet Media Type ("MIME type") of the file whose content is to embed, or null to let the method automatically retrieve the from the file type extension.
The encoding to use to embed the file content.
member.returns: A "data" URL, into which the content of the file provided by the parameter is embedded.

example.note: For the sake of better readability, exception handling is ommitted in the example.

member.exception: is not a valid file path.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl.TryGetData(System.String,FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.EmbeddedData@,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the embedded data as a union that contains either a or an array of s, and also an appropriate file type extension for this data.
member.param: A "data" URL according to RFC 2397.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains the embedded data as an union. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains an appropriate file type extension for . The extension starts with the period ".". The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if is a valid "data" URL, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Use this method if you want to use the data in the application.

example.note: For the sake of better readability, exception handling is ommitted in the example.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl.TryGetData(System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Char},FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.EmbeddedData@,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the embedded data as a union that contains either a or an array of s, and also an appropriate file type extension for this data.
member.param: A read-only memory that contains a "data" URL according to RFC 2397.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains the embedded data as an union. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains an appropriate file type extension for . The extension starts with the period ".". The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if is a valid "data" URL, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Use this method if you want to use the data in the application.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl.TryGetBytes(System.String,System.Byte[]@,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the embedded data as a array, and also an appropriate file type extension for this data.
member.param: A "data" URL according to RFC 2397.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains the embedded data. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains an appropriate file type extension for . The extension starts with the period ".". The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if is a valid "data" URL, otherwise false.
member.remarks: The method fails only if a decoding error occurs. The use of the method is particularly recommended if the embedded data of the "data" URL should be saved in a file.

example.note: For the sake of better readability, exception handling is ommitted in the example.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl.TryGetBytes(System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Char},System.Byte[]@,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the embedded data as a array, and also an appropriate file type extension for this data.
member.param: A read-only memory that contains a "data" URL according to RFC 2397.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains the embedded data. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains an appropriate file type extension for . The extension starts with the period ".". The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if is a valid "data" URL, otherwise false.
member.remarks: The method fails only if a decoding error occurs. The use of the method is particularly recommended if the embedded data of the "data" URL should be saved in a file.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl.TryGetText(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the embedded text and the file type extension from the .
member.param: A "data" URL according to RFC 2397.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains the embedded text. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains an appropriate file type extension for . The extension starts with the period ".". The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if is a valid "data" URL that contains embedded text, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Use this method if you are only interested in a specific text that may be embedded in the "data" URL.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl.TryGetText(System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Char},System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the embedded text and the file type extension from the .
member.param: A read-only memory that contains a "data" URL according to RFC 2397.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains the embedded text. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains an appropriate file type extension for . The extension starts with the period ".". The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if is a valid "data" URL that contains embedded text, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Use this method if you are only interested in a specific text that may be embedded in the "data" URL.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl.TryParse(System.String,FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrlInfo@)
member.summary: Tries to parse a that represents a "data" URL in order to make its content available as .
member.param: The to parse.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains a structure that provides the contents of the "data" URL. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if could be parsed as , otherwise false.

example.note: For the sake of better readability, exception handling is ommitted in the example.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrl.TryParse(System.ReadOnlyMemory{System.Char},FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrlInfo@)
member.summary: Tries to parse a ReadOnlyMemory<Char> that represents a "data" URL in order to make its content available as .
member.param: The ReadOnlyMemory<Char> to parse.
If the method returns true, the parameter contains a structure that provides the contents of the "data" URL. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if could be parsed as , false otherwise.

member.name: T:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrlInfo
member.summary: Provides the information stored in a "data" URL (RFC 2397).

note.para: is a quite large structure. Pass it to other methods by reference (in, ref or out parameters in C#)!

If you intend to hold a for a long time in memory and if this is parsed from a ReadOnlyMemory<Char> that comes from a very long , keep in mind, that the holds a reference to that . Consider in this case to make a copy of the structure with : The copy is built on a separate that is case-normalized and only as long as needed.

example.note: For the sake of better readability, exception handling is ommitted in the example.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrlInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary: Creates a hash code for this instance.
member.returns: The hash code.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrlInfo.System#ICloneable#Clone
member.remarks:
If you intend to hold a for a long time in memory and if this is parsed from a ReadOnlyMemory<Char> that comes from a very long , keep in mind, that the holds a reference to that . Consider in this case to make a copy of the structure: The copy is built on a separate that is case-normalized and only as long as needed.
Use the instance method , if you can, to avoid the costs of boxing.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrlInfo.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new , which is a copy of this instance.
member.remarks: The copy is built on a separate , which is case-normalized and only as long as needed.

member.name: P:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrlInfo.Data
member.summary: The part of the "data" URL, which contains the embedded data.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrlInfo.TryAsText(System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the text, which is embedded in the "data" URL.
member.param: If the method returns true, the parameter contains the embedded text. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the embedded could be converted to a , otherwise false.

remarks.para: The method succeeds only if the property returns .
Use this method if you are only interested in a specific text that may be embedded in the "data" URL.

member.name: M:FolkerKinzel.DataUrls.DataUrlInfo.TryAsBytes(System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Tries to retrieve the embedded as a array.
member.param: If the method returns true, the parameter contains the embedded data. The parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the embedded in the "data" URL could be converted to a array, otherwise false.
member.remarks: The method fails only if a decoding error occurs. The use of the method is particularly recommended if the embedded data of the "data" URL should be saved in a file.
